      • createPDFReportCoverPage

        public static void createPDFReportCoverPage(InternalEquinoxTask<?> task,
                                            com.itextpdf.text.Document document,
                                            com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfWriter writer,
                                            java.lang.String title,
                                            java.lang.String[] chapterNames,
                                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.nio.file.Path> fileAttachments)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates PDF report cover page.
        Parameters:
        task - Calling task.
        document - PDF document.
        writer - PDF writer.
        title - Report title.
        chapterNames - Array containing the chapter names.
        fileAttachments - File attachment mapping. The key is the name of attachment, the value is the path to attached file. Null should be given if there is no attachment.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If exception occurs during process.

      • extractFileFromGZIP

        public static void extractFileFromGZIP(java.nio.file.Path gzipFile,
                                       java.nio.file.Path outputFile)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Extracts a file from GZIP package.
        Parameters:

      • extractFileFromZIP

        public static java.nio.file.Path extractFileFromZIP(java.nio.file.Path zipFile,
                                                    InternalEquinoxTask<?> task,
                                                    FileType type,
                                                    java.nio.file.Path outputDir)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Extracts and returns a file with the demanded file type from the given ZIP file. Note that, the first file with the given file type will be extracted and returned.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - Path to ZIP file.
        task - Task which calls this method.
        type - The type of file to extract.
        outputDir - Output directory. If null is given, the working directory of the task will be used (if the task is not temporary file creating task, then a new working directory will be created).
        Returns:
        The extracted temporary file or null if no file with given file type could be found within the given ZIP file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If exception occurs during process.

      • extractFilesFromZIP

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.nio.file.Path> extractFilesFromZIP(java.nio.file.Path zipFile,
                                                                          TemporaryFileCreatingTask<?> task,
                                                                          FileType type)
                                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Extracts and returns temporary files with the demanded file type from the given ZIP file. Note that, the first file with the given file type will be extracted and returned.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - Path to ZIP file.
        task - Task which calls this method.
        type - The type of file to extract.
        Returns:
        The extracted temporary files or null if no file with given file type could be found within the given ZIP file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If exception occurs during process.

                                                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Extracts and returns all files from the given ZIP file.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - Path to ZIP file.
        task - Task which calls this method.
        outputDir - Output directory.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If exception occurs during process.

        Parameters:
        fileName - File name to be checked.
        Returns:
        Warning message text if the file name is invalid, otherwise null.

      • isValidEmailAddress

        public static boolean isValidEmailAddress(java.lang.String email)
        Validate the form of an email address.

        Return true only if

        • aEmailAddress can successfully construct an InternetAddress
        • when parsed with "@" as delimiter, aEmailAddress contains two tokens which satisfy textHasContent(java.lang.String).

        The second condition arises since local email addresses, simply of the form "albert", for example, are valid for InternetAddress, but almost always undesired.

        Parameters:
        email - Email address string to validate.
        Returns:
        True if given email address string is a valid email address.
